Section 18 Applications of definite integrals

¶

Some words.

Subsection 18.1 Area between curves

¶

Some words.

Definition 18.1. Area between curves.

Given that \(f(x)\) and \(g(x)\) are continuous and that \(f(x) \ge g(x)\) on the interval from \(x = a\) to \(x = b\text{,}\) the area between the curves \(f(x)\) and \(g(x)\) from \(x = a\) to \(x = b\) is given by

\begin{equation*} \int_a^b \Big(f(x) - g(x)\Big)\,dx \end{equation*}
Example 18.2. degree-day accumulation.

Degree-days are used as a way to measure growth and development in plants and other temperature-dependent species, such as insects.

Example 18.3. area between curves.

Find the area between the curves \(f(x) = x^2\) and \(g(x) = x^3\) between \(x = 0\) and \(x = 1\text{.}\)

Subsection 18.2 Average value of a function

¶

Some words.

Definition 18.4. Average value of a function.

The average value for a function \(f(x)\) on the interval from \(x = a\) to \(x = b\) is

\begin{equation*} \text{average value of f} = \hat f = \dfrac{1}{b-a}\int_a^b \Big(f(x) - g(x)\Big)\,dx \end{equation*}
Example 18.5. resource use.

An oil company describes the rate of change in consumption of oil resources (in billions of barrels) using the equation

\begin{equation*} \dfrac{dc}{dt} = 1.2e^{0.04t} \end{equation*}

with \(t = 0\) indicating the year 1998.

  1. Using a definite integral, compute the total resource consumption over the first ten years since 1998. Note: If you use \(u\)-substitution, be sure to transform the limits of integration, otherwise change back to the original variable!

  2. What is the average rate of consumption over the period?

  3. Repeat these two steps for the next ten years, the period from 2008 to 2018.

Example 18.6. resource use - extension.

In 1998, the above company estimated 30 billion barrels in the reserve. Compute the definite integral that gives the total consumption over the first \(T\) years since 1998,

\begin{equation*} \int_0^{20} 1.2e^{0.04t}\, dt, \end{equation*}

and use the resulting formula to find how many years it will take for the 30 billion barrel supply to be exhausted. Note: Set the result of the definite integral equal to \(30\) and solve for \(T\text{.}\)

Exercises 18.3 Quick Practice

1.
Compute the average value of \(f(x) = x\) on the interval from \(x=0\) to \(x=2\text{.}\)
2.
Compute the average value of \(g(x)=x−x2\) on the interval from \(x=0\) to \(x=1\text{.}\)
